EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
• Intended for processing copper plates into copper cables.  
• Consists of the following interconnected entities:  
 – Burner inserter at position (2.5, 16.5) (retrieved as the new factory burner inserter)  
 – Cable factory input chest at position (2.5, 17.5)  
 – Dedicated burner inserter at position (3.5, 17.5) placed at the factory interface  
 – Assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at position (1.5, 19.5) that utilizes the inputs for cable production

### Wooden Chest Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
• Serves as an isolated belt depot to facilitate multi‐segment transport belt connections from the extraction system.  
• Consists of the following entities:  
 – Wooden chest at position (3.5, 15.5) (crafted and successfully placed as depot)  
 – Transport belt segment at position (4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest  
 – Dedicated depot burner inserter at position (3.5, 14.5) (placed using direction UP, with neighbours including the chest and belt segment)

### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
• Provides the source extraction point for raw items via a burner inserter mechanism.  
• Consists of the following entity:  
 – Burner inserter at position (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)

### Electricity Generator at position (–0.5, 24.5)
• Functions as the power generation hub for connected systems.  
• Consists of the following interconnected entities:  
 – Steam engine (generator) at position (–0.5, 24.5)  
 – Boiler at position (–5.5, 24.0)  
 – Offshore pump at position (–7.5, 25.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Target Errors  
 – Transport belts must not be connected directly to a SteamEngine object. Always ensure the target is a valid inserter that feeds into the SteamEngine rather than the SteamEngine itself.

• Placement Distance Failures  
 – Confirm that the player is within the allowed placement range before attempting to place an entity. Moving closer to the target position will avoid distance-related placement errors.

• Inventory Shortage Issues  
 – Verify that the required item (for example, a wooden chest) is present in the inventory before attempting its placement to prevent errors from insufficient resources.

• Undefined Variable References  
 – Check that all variables (such as target_chest) are correctly declared and referenced to avoid NameError exceptions.
